head.title: World Briefing | Asia: Japan: Popular Support For Abe Falls Again

hedline.hl1: World Briefing | Asia: Japan: Popular Support For Abe Falls Again

abstract.p: Support for Prime Min Shinzo Abe of Japan drops to its lowest since he took office in September; his approval ratings have suffered from recent suicide of his agricultural minister and from government's mishandling of pension records; fall increases possibility that governing party may lose seats in upper house election; photo (S)

block.p: Support for Prime Minister Shinzo Abe dropped to its lowest since he took office in September, hovering at 30 percent in a poll by the national daily Asahi Shimbun. Other polls indicated a similar slide in Mr. Abe's approval ratings, which have suffered from the recent suicide of his scandal-tainted agricultural minister and from the government's mishandling of pension records. The fall increased the possibility that his governing Liberal Democratic Party might lose seats in July's upper house election; an outright defeat could spur calls for him to step down as party leader and prime minister.
